text: If you looking for a hotdog on vegas, this is the spot, definetly the best on vegas, must try if you local !!!!!

First stop on a mini food tour of the Container Park.  We tried the Classic Cheffinis (grilled frank, onions, tomatoes, jalapenos, mozzarella, crushed potato chips, pineapple sauce, mustard, mayo and ketchup) except we had them leave off the jalepenos.  Just reading this list, the two that seemed unusual where the potato chips and pineapple sauce.  I'd never had potato chips on a hot dog like this, but I was completely confident they would work great.  But, I admit that I had some doubt about the pineapple sauce.  I shouldn't have.  The sweet tanginess blended perfectly with other flavors.

They also earn bonus points for free refills on the lemonade.

- Food: Hot dogs had excellent quality ingredients, creative, delicious, well-balanced flavor. Fries were hot, fresh, crisp on outside, very well-cooked
- Service: Okay. Lady taking orders and serving food seemed pretty annoyed to be there and having to talk to us, but still have recommendations. She was polite enough to speak when bringing our hot food to our outdoor table. 
-Physical setup: Cool little place. Small space inside, but can seat groups of 2-4 easily. Plenty of outdoor seating for groups.

I will go back if in Vegas again, but the place lost a star because of the service.

BEST hotdogs ever!!!!! I can't say enough for this place yes it's only a hotdog right, no way it's an AMAZING hotdog!!!! I had the el mexicano and my husband and I come here all the time!!!! The French fries with cheese and bacon are delicious but again I could go on and on on how great these hotdogs are with the toasted buns and delicious ingredients!!! We have tried almost all of them but the el mexicano is the best and we will not go anywhere else when we are craving a hotdog or some good quick food we head right to Cheffinis!!!!
Got the Cheffini dog and a Naked dog with bacon and cream cheese, since I could choose my own toppings. Very yummy. So tasty.

This is the best hotdog place in the whole state of Nevada. I'm an extremely picky eater, but I have had almost all of the dogs here and they are AMAZING! They also have veggie dogs, and without the meat the dogs are just as good.

The cherry pepper relish on El Mexicano and the pineapple sauce and crushed potato chips on the Classic Cheffini dog are out of this world good!! I've never had anything like the sauces made at Cheffinis, and all of the flavors together are a perfect balance.
Hot dogs are delicious and the topping very original.  Recommend to try the sweet potato fries.

Cheffini's has amazing vegan dogs! Get the cheffini but be sure to ask for it began so they leave off the cheese and mayo. Trust me you won't miss it! Great late night eats or a quick daytime snack! Don't miss this place!

Food is ok but I dont see why it takes 20min plus to get a kids hotdog.  Worst service.. itsxsucked as pork n bean container and its sucks now as cheffinis.  Its so sad it could be a great place if the owner knew whats what and trained his staff.  The countergirl could not take my ordrr cuz she was counting by er drawer and other ppl were waiting on food and did not pay either cuz she was counting. Tastes ok executed poorly.

This was my first time here. And my experience was amazing. Erica and her crew were outstanding and very nice. Erica made you feel very welcomed and was very knowledgable of the community, company,and menu. This a great place to be and I would defiantly come back again and tell others to come and taste their creativity and see Erica.

Looking for something different in Las Vegas, we headed over to the Container Park in Downtown Las Vegas. After some shopping and watching my son play in the big playground, we got hungry and chose to try Cheffini's Hot Dogs. They specialize in hot dogs, but that's not all they offer. You can get burger sliders, empanadas, shakes, etc.

You might feel a little claustrophobic when you walk in. After all, the entire establishment fits in one or two shipping containers. But that's part of the charm of this place. They have a good menu with plenty of options. But here's what we got:

Me: The El Mexicano. A sirloin hotdog wrapped in bacon. Comes with avocado, tomatoes, green sauce, chipotle guava, garlic aioli, cherry pepper relish and cilantro. It was delicious! I could have eat two if I didn't order fries. Every bite was bursting with flavor.

Wife: My wife ordered a vegan dog which she loved. She also got fries with chimichurri sauce. There are toppings that you can pile on your fries. The fries can be shared with two people.

Son: My son got the crunchy dog which comes notably with crushed potato chips and bacon bits.

There is a good selection of toppings and sauces for dogs and fries. They had beer available, but I opted for ice tea, which was very good. The prices are good and the staff is friendly. After finishing our meal, we hung out at the park and watched kids jam on stage. They were from the "School of Rock". So not only is Cheffini's a great place to eat, it's in a great location.

Incredible hot dogs ...  excellent quality, creative toppings, hip decor, fun environment, friendly staff. It's a grab-and-go type of eatery, perfect for lunchtime, though they also have tables if you want to sit down with a beer. I'm going to keep coming back until I've tried every type of hot dog on their menu. 

Huge props to them for offering vegan hot dogs, too, which makes it easy for me to bring my vegetarian boyfriend along.
Great find in the downtown area. Freemont East section in the Container Park. Hot dogs hit the spot. Also have Turkey and Vegan dogs.  Loved it.

I love this place. Great dogs and  great beer selection.Make sure to try the Grandfather, one of the best Hot dogs I've ever had. Highly recommend it.
I can't wait to go back!
Nothing really special or gourmet about this place. Everything was ok. Everything was just ok from the food to the service.
High quality gourmet hot dogs. Kind of pricey and a long wait time for hot dogs, but definitely something different. El Mexicano and the Grand Father dog are excellent choices
best hotdogs I have ever had in my life, naked turkey with ched chipotle guava and pickle mango on fleek

I was pleasantly surprised to hear that they had a vegan hotdog option, so I went to try it out and it did not disappoint! I got it with sriracha and avocado, yum! It's so great that they opted to use Field Roast brand of vegan hotdogs--soy free and a much healthier choice in comparison to other veg brands. Kudos, guys! 
Also, the service was great! ((The dog did take a little while, but they're made to order and worth the wait))

Went here while on vacation and the hot dogs here are great. The buns is soft and the hot dog has that snap when you bite into it. It offers funky toppings like cream cheese and crushed potato chips. Would recommend it to anyone tourist or resident.
Vegan hot dog with crushed potato chips?!?! Are you kidding me... only thing missing is a few vegan sauces.  The carnivores in the group were not diggin' there's unfortunately thus the 3 stars.
It a god place for eat and out side it's a play ground ask for the crunchy dog  or the salchipapas

I WANT ANOTHER!! excellent little spot in container park in downtown las vegas. these originally-crafted hot dogs are truly one of a kind and make you wonder all this time why you've been eating hotdogs with just ketchup & mustard. 

NOTE: they have turkey dogs for you health nuts and vegan dogs for you even crazier health nuts

The hot dogs were fine.  My kids split a mini-cheffini and I got one of their fancy ones (can't remember the name, started with a P) and we got a lemonade.  Easy order, right?  Two hot dogs and one lemonade.  Came to around $15.  Hmm, ok...only two hot dogs and drink....no sides... The real reason I give this place though was the wait...I swear I waited about 20+ minutes.  Again, only two hot dogs and the one for my kids was plain!  They weren't all that busy so I have no idea what took so long.

Maaaannn.... I'm from L.A and every single time I got to Las Vegas (usually 5 times a year) I ALWAYS hit this place up! Me and the lady always order 4 of the Classic Cheffinis with extra pineapple sauce. This place is just awesome! If only they had a place here in LA!!!

The store front is small, but clean with a nice window for people watching. The Mexicano was amazing- reading the list of topping it was hard to believe everyone would blend so well but it did. I'm not a big hot dog fan but I'll definitely go back to Cheffini's.  Sauce served with the fries was great, too!

Update- went back with the husband and it was even better this round. Tried the burger- how have I not had chips on my burger before? We will definitely be back!

Short Review:

2 dogs, 2 sodas, 1 fries = $25+

Good hot dogs. 
Not that good.

Went to Container Park for dinner and some park action on a beautiful night as a way to spend time with my son. 

I loved the menu. Tons of variation between their dogs. The only thing I was bummed about was that I didn't have anyone else with me to justify getting more hot dogs to try. 

I got the Panchero because I love chorizo. (My four year old said next time he's getting that one ). But I also got the Moshi Moshi (spicy) which took the cake between the two. I ate half of each and brought the remainder home for the roomie just to share the experience. 
My kiddo got a plain hotdog with ketchup and mustard and he was all over it. (Kids can be in Container Park until 9pm.)
Sauces are free. You can customize your dogs or order whichever of the many dogs they offer. 
I'm not a hotdog person (I maybe eat 1per year) but they have me wanting to go back for more. 
Draft and bottled beers are offered and they have different happy hour deals. 

The staff was great, very friendly.

So I was checking out the container park and seen this on the way out. I said to myself... self you need to try this out tomorrow since I was too full from drinks earlier. 
The next day returned at lunch and it was busy but fairly fast checked in and received a free soda. Stared at the menu for awhile because I was having a tough time on deciding which dog to get, they all looked so good! 
Finally went with The Godfather and it was very delicious. I would of never thought of some of the toppings going together like the mango with red bell pepper haha but with all the other goodness on there it did very well! Would gladly eat again. 
The only thing I'd change if I could would be to have a larger dog or even a sausage option 
Also had some friends loaded fries and chili cheese fries. I'd go with the loaded fries and add a little more sauce or hey mix the chili cheese fries with the loaded mmmmm

We were greeted by the sweet cashier and I started to look at the menu options.
There are a lot!

Fancy toppings, a vegan dog, potato chip topping......I was really excited! Hubby and I wanted a snack so we decided to split one.

She made a suggestion that the style with the seaweed on it is super good. Sounds good but it has mayo and stuff on it.

We opted for a vegan dog with sweet relish (they have spicy also), mustard, and potato chips :))))) we had water so we didn't need a drink. I saw two taps so I think they even offer beer. 

Then the downer...your total is $7.xx. With a smile. Ok. That's about as much as a Field Roast dog at ATT Park! Ouch! Ok.
I really never mind high prices it's really normal in casinos and also in the vendors at CP but for some reason I found it off putting tonight. Note: vegan dogs are $1 more than regular. 

Anyway the lovely lady also offered that they slice it in half because we were sharing.

Within a few short minutes we had our hot dog. It was good. Really good actually. It was the bun that was a total turn on. Soft in the middle with a few outer areas that were crisp almost (no it was not stale).

All in all we really enjoy the two bites each that we had and really could eat more. I didn't really ask hubby what he thought about the price, but I will. Maybe he is just used to the CP markup.

Go splurge on a fancy hotdog, have one of those loaded up topping ones. Now that I look...most of those are around $7-9. So I guess we got a deal?

I had the cheffini dog and it was great, great flavor and beautifully stacked! I'm looking forward to the grandfather dog! If you nearby, this a fun and delicious place to stop by and enjoy a couple dogs and beers!!
really good hot dog. Got the Mexican and the fresh avocado on top was a nice addition.

Too many good options! I love hot dogs and this place had some of the best toppings I've ever seen... Rivaling my own home creations.

Quail egg? Yum. Seaweed? How did I not think of that before?

We grabbed a beer as well and sat in the outdoor deck space. This whole container park is pretty adorable and wholesome... Especially when you stop to realize you're in Vegas.

Overall, this spot is approachable and also hip... Much like a hot dog with a quail egg on it.

Really great hotdogs!!! We got the Crispy dog... It had bacon, cooked peppers and onions, potato chips, topped with spicy mayo as well as mustard and seaweed chips!!! Really yummy!!! Come check out the awesome hotdogs! So good!

Love that this place has vegan options and the vegan dog is pretty good. They can make any menu item "vegan" but they don't really have substitutes for the toppings. They will just put the topping that are vegan so basically no mayos which to me make the hotdogs 10x better in my opinion.

The hotdog itself was good but smothered in too much sauce. I would stick to a Nathan's dog with ketchup. That just maybe my personal preference. The place is small but clean and the people were friendly and helpful.
Yummy great dog.  Shared with my husband one dog.  Perfect snack.  One would have been a meal.  Super friendly service
Yes, yes, yes. Perfect in almost every way.
This is one of the best things I've ever ate.  It's located in Container Park- Downtown Las Vegas.  It's not your traditional hotdog.  The Chef deserves a handshake for sure!!!!  Awesome..

Hot dogs are pretty good, I had the Cheffinis and it's ok, nothing out of this world. The shop is small inside the container park. The staff is friendly. Only thing that was a bummer was after I checked in i got this coupon from yelp for a free drink, I walked inside to redeem it and the cashier turned around to look at the cook and he said " we aren't doing the Yelp coupons anymore" -_- WELL THEN TAKE IT OFF! 

Would I come here again- maybe if I'm downtown..

I wish I liked random things on my hot dog so I could appreciate their gourment hot dogs. But I'm picky and I hate most vegetables. 

However, this place did not let me down! I was able to choose my own ingredients and make my own dog!! 

I got the plain dog and added cream cheese, chorizo, and avocado... weird combination but WOW!! It was SOOO GOOD!!! I'll definitely be coming back!!

Cheffini's Hot Dogs is one of my favorite gourmet-style/creative hot dog joints. I love hot dogs, whether it's plain or loaded with toppings. Sometimes hot dogs with crazy toppings can get a little too crazy and/or too messy for me. However, this is not the case at Cheffini's. 

I tried the El Mexicano and it was amazing -- not too much going on and all the flavors melded so well with each other! The El Mexicano is bacon-wrapped and is topped with avocados, chipotle guava, some *mysterious* yet delicious green sauce, garlic aioli and cherry pepper relish. And it is just as good as it sounds. Even though I haven't tried their other options, I have high hopes that the other hot dogs are just as good. Seriously, the other menu selections all sounded so delicious -- can't wait to come back and try the others!
This is a great snack place.  Great riff on hot dogs.  Draft beer!  Lagunitas!  For kids and adults.  Get your snack on here!

How cool is Fremont these days? It has something for everyone, especially in the container park. Great bars, a huge playground in the middle, and a wonderful hot dog joint! The buns and wieners are fairly basic, what makes their offerings special are the toppings. The dogs come out picture perfect, and taste great. I got the Mexican and it was spot on, muy bueno indeed!

UPDATE --- Was contacted by the owner to try to make things right. I am changing my rating to reflect that  ---This place has decent food. But the people behind the counter are rude. Made sure to order loaded fries with no meat and ordered a vegan dog but after one bite you could tell it wasn't. So I went back inside to be promptly told it's a dollar more.. no I am sorry. Nothing. Will never be coming here to deal with the selective hearing and the pissed poor customer service.
Went for a walk at Container Park with my wife.  She suggested this place for dinner.  If you like to try different things this is the place.  Great Hot Dogs.

5-4-2017  (this is Jim Isenberg yelping from my friends Kitty's phone, since I do not have an account) my second experience in container park and after a few drinks and good company at Oak and Ivy, I decide to get a hotdog, after all my friend had had nothing but good things to say about this joint...  I winded and specifically asked what time you closed & I was told 11pm. I came back in at 10:15 to order and I was told that the Fryolator was already turned off for the night. So I altered my order and while I was waiting, the employee (she)  with attitude began to block the floor and put up the chairs at 10:20, working around me (which is very rude) and by 1030 the door was locked. I understand that they're young and wanted a night out and leave before 11 but, none ever wants to be  treated unfairly & spoken to with an attitude. I tired calling serval times today 5-5-2017 to speak with the owner because of how offended I am by her behavior but, she refused to allow me to leave a message. Saying "you (meaning Me) can write an email or leave a compliant but, like I said, that'll go through me too" --if she were working one of my restaurants. Shes be fired by now.

Pretty good hot dogs, I wish I had better things to say. The only thing I wanted was a chili dog, a classic chili dog.... but they only sell them on weekends. Chili fries are only on weekends as well. Everything else just seems too out of the ordinary that I wouldn't want to eat. Not enough classics for a gourmet hot dog stand, in my opinion. Chili fries are always a good idea.... makes no sense to only offer them on weekends. I'm a local and avoid the strip / downtown on weekends as it's way too crowded for comfort, so I probably won't be back.

The food was great. The service not so great. Both times I've been there, the cashiers have had attitudes up the ass. It sucks that the fries don't come with the hot dogs but the prices are decent. The service was just terrible though. If you don't want to work there than why would you stay there!
You can get a better hot dog at the airport in Chicago for less. Sorry, but I think they are overpriced. Low quality dog and nearly worthless buns.

Wonderful atmosphere in that little container!! Robbi was pleasant, Sara was extremely helpful and Claudia cooked up the best dogs we have had in quite some time. 
Pros:  Cheffini's ingredients were fresh and our party of 11 got our food extremely quickly.  The Cheffini was awesome - tasty, explosive flavors with jalapeños  clashing with pineapple sauce drizzled over the top - my mouth was shouting WOW!
Cons: only have 2 locations in Vegas and nome in ATL where it would go over like gangbusters! 
Keep up the great work, Cheffini's!
Will def be telling all my friends the charm of old downtown las vegas is back!!

I was attending a play at container park and decided to try cheffinis. It was crowded and my first impression was they did not do well under pressure. The staff were bickering with each other about how to expedite the orders and when to close the coffee shop next door. I placed my order ( 1 naked dog and two kids meals with sliders). After 20 minutes of waiting I was told they didn't have anymore sliders and I could either get my money back or get a hotdog instead. I chose hot dog since I had already waited so long. A few minutes later the cashier came to one of the guys dining and told him he gave him an extra elder by mistake. The guy said, " I haven't touched it" and the cashier took it. Another 10 minutes past and I received 1slider which was supposed to have the special sauce. No sauce. I also received the hot dog that was substituted for the slider kids meal I paid for with no fries and no sauce. And a mediocre hot dog. To this day I am praying I didn't receive the side that was retrieved from the guy dining and regret the time and money wasted. I will never return or recommend. Horrible experience.

The hotdogs were amazing, but the employee made the mistake of giving me fries(which I thought came with my order). Even after I was eating them she came back and took them away from us. They can't serve them to anyone else so why take it away?!?! It left me with a bit of a salty taste in my mouth.
Is she didn't take my free fries away it woulda been five stars.
Great spot to grab a gourmet specialty dog. House favorite is the Cheffini. Great flavors and environment. Gotta love the Downtown Container Park and all it has to offer.

Best Hot Dogs in Las Vegas!! 
I love Cheffini's!!! 

Before opening the Container Park location, they only had their street-cart on Fremont St. Ahhhh, my first time was a typically drunken night out bar-hopping with my girlfriends and they crazed about getting a Cheffini hot dog. They told me to have everything on it, and I had no clue what some of the ingredients the owner was topping it off with, but wow when I took my first bite into it, it was so darn good!!! The sauce they have on it is soo good and my favorite part are the crispy chips they put on top too! It's so unique and so yummy. Congrats to them to opening up an official store in downtown container park! I love how they even have more items on their menu. I've tried a few and they all tasted good! But my ultimate favorite will always be their original Cheffini's hot dog. YUMMMM!!
Best hot dogs in town ! Haven't found anything like them. The owner is super nice & I can't wait to go back already.
I loved their service and hospitality!  Not to mention that the actual hot dog is off the chain! I would recommend this place 110%. #Bomb.com

Super leuke plek om te eten. Het is in het containerpark. Onwijs vriendelijk personeel. Ze waren vergeten een deel van de bestelling aan te slaan en direct krijgen we de vergeten hot dog gratis, al stonden we met het geld klaar. Lovely!

Went to get my daughter a hot dog so I ordered the $8 special which according to the sign said hot dog and drink.....can't remember what else but it doesn't matter.  Cashier rudely told me that it was $16 and some change.....I asked her why and she said I ordered a hot dog and a special........I said no, that was one special with ketchup, mustard and relish on the hot dog. Her response was we don't do it that way sir.....BTW I am a Transgender woman!  I simply said I had ordered it that way before and she very rudely stated well not here you didn't and we ain't doin that way now.......so I left.!
Living here in the Downtown Community it was very disturbing to see this type of rude uncalled for behavior......they are the same way in the attached coffe shop. 
Very non supportive to the LGBT Community and I do believe this was discriminating to a certain degree.......
Much better service a block down the street at FLIPPIN' GOOD Burgers and Fries
Excellent vegan hotdogs with lots of topping options. By far the best hotdog I've ever had. Cheese fries were delicious. Thanks for the great food!

One of my favorite little spots to hit when I go to Container Park what's there to complain about the beer is the best price in the whole container park at this place and it's called and the hot dogs delish highly recommend stop by grab a drink say hello and eat a tasty hot dog

These hot dogs are AMAZING! Great for locals to head out downtown and grab a quick bite. So many great combinations. The meal deal is a steal with a beer. I wish they could come up with like a sample of each dog, like a platter. Too Much good stuff.

I stopped into this new addition at the Container Park after work and decided to start with the litmus test:  Naked hot dog with just mustard and onions.  I wanted to actually taste the hot dog, not just guess what it tastes like under mounds of toppings.  

The hot dog was nigh perfect!  Good and tight on the outside, moist and tender inside and full of flavor.  The bun was not mushy and added well to the experience.   Reminds me of the great concession dogs you would get at a theatre or ball park before they invented the dreaded steam roller.  The dog was an A+.  Totally worth 5 bucks.

My complaint comes with the drink, at 3 dollars and small, it seems it added a lot to the total price without any real value.  Several places nearby have the same size for almost half the price.  Also something wrong with the lids they use, wouldn't stay on and leaked so much, I did away with it quick.

Overall great food and choice, but think drink should find a bit lower price point.

A Cheffini's hot dog with simple ketchup and onions hits the spot. Or a Cheffini's hot dog with everything on it is pretty amazing also. And I'm not the type of girl to bedazzle my hot dogs. I usually like them with as little condiments as possible. But there's just something so damn good about having all those crunchy and savory toppings on that dog (and drunkenly biting into it your first time is life changing).

We were downtown today and decided to stop into cheffinis for vegan dogs. 
I've had regular cheffinis back in my meat eating days, but haven't been there since going vegan over a year ago. I've heard the vegan dog is amazing and I was hoping the hype was for good reason..
We ordered the special which is a PBR & dog. We got our beers and sat. After what seemed like a really long wait our dogs came out. The dogs were as amazing as I remember! The vegan dog is flavorful and chewy but not rubbery like faux meats are sometimes. The toppings were great as usual (that pineapple sauce and crumbled chips are soooo yummy!). 
As for service, that leaves much to be desired. As well as time for the food to come, although there was only one other person there. I appreciate that it's all fresh, but I think we waited about 15 mins..for hot dogs. Nonetheless, it's vegan hot dogs so I'll deal w it for my occasional hot dog desire! 
So really my 4 stars is for the food, if I was  rating service and wait time it would be a 2-3.

I've been here twice now, and both times... Meh is pretty much the word I'd use to describe it. The first time, they forgot to place our order, and we ended up waiting over 30 minutes before they realized it. They were very apologetic, but still... The second time, they were out of sliders (yes, I know it is a hot dog place, but I wanted sliders!), and I ordered the grilled cheese instead. Definitely MEH. I could have made a better grilled cheese sandwich at home- and I have. The loaded fries were okay, but nothing to write home about. My friend said that his hot dogs were pretty good, but not fantastic. It is in a great location in Container Park, and the outdoor eating area is nice, especially on a sunny spring day, but I'm not itching to go back again.

I ordered Cheffini's late at night via UberEats - I'm not sure where the error came in, but they canceled my order before the driver arrived. Luckily, the driver called me to let me know. I was able to re-order with a minimal delay.

I was hungry and jetlagged, so I ordered the "Classic Cheffini" to see what they're known for. The dog I liked the most was the "Grandfather" - I have never seen a quail egg placed so delicately on a hot dog before, it was delicious!

I also ordered sweet potato fries with their special pineapple dipping sauce, make sure you get this sauce too! Didn't finish the fries, but they reheated well the next night!

Good pricing, great tasting and very filling!
Great hot dogs and cold beer. Go America!!!!  The food was quick and very tasty. Has a small selection of beer but they are different and very tasty. Wide variety of hot digs on the menu.

This is another winning spot in LV's fantastic Container Park.

Cheffini's hot dogs are interesting and delicious.

The interior space can get really cramped because there's seating inside but the line can get long and you might end up being pretty cozy with the other customers.  But there's seating outside, too, and you can easily transport these dogs elsewhere.

We tried a Classic Cheffini which comes with all sorts of sauces and onions and tomatoes and crushed potato chips, etc. on it.  It was huge, juicy and delicious, as all weiners should be.  

We also tried the naked weiner (ahem) and it, too, was terrific.  Sometimes a naked weiner has the best flavor, or so I have read.

Not cheap at all (especially the naked dog for $5) but these are really delicious, quality hot dogs.

I wanted a quick bite to eat and found this place while roaming around container park. Menu is straightforward and very easy to read. I decided in the Moshi Moshi Turkey Dog and Wow, I loved it. It comes with caramelized  onions, jalapenos, wine sauce, spicy mayo topped with sesame seeds between a just perfectly toasted bun. The flavors were well put together and it was a great size. The 2 sauces were not overwhelming at all. Check In for a free drink.
I live downtown go there all the time, I even hit up the hot dog cart they have out some nights.  I really love there food especially the sliders. I'd recommend this place to anyone.

Went here at 10 pm. They close at 11. I wanted to other fries and dude working said no. Unless I were to "too him a few dollars" to turn the fryer back on. Horrible customer service dude was a chode. Won't be visiting again.

Extremely tasty gourmet hotdogs! It certainly complements the atmosphere of the Container Park well. They also had a large selection of yummy sounding hot dogs to choose from. I also liked how they gave us free drink refills. My only thing is that the food doesn't really match the photos they have. I got the El Mexicano (the one with the avocados because I dig avocados), expecting many slices of avocado because that's what was shown in the picture on their counter. Little did I know it only comes with 2-3 small slices. It was still good, but why hype up the expectations only to bring them down?

My go to spot in Vegas every time I come.  Somehow they make hot dogs taste better than eating a good steak.  The prices are cheap, and the food is insanely good.  Great flavor combinations! The El Mexicano my go to, but the one with the potato chips and quail egg is amazing as well!  Great location, cool area, more than worth checking out!

My girlfriend and I made our way to Container Park for a work get together of hers and decided to give Cheffini's a go since we there.

First and foremost I loved the selection of toppings that they had for the food and was very intrigued to try something new! I went with the Cheffinis which had potato chips and pineapple sauce along with a bunch of other toppings and was very happy with my decision. It was DELICIOUS. My Girlfriend ended up getting their sliders and we shared a side of their cheese fries. They whole meal was wonderful and was perfect for the venue being at the Container Park. 

The woman working at the register was quick and efficient all while being very friendly and personable. Along with her the runner who brought us our food was super helpful and ensured all of our order was correct along with asking if there was anymore he could do before darting off to run other orders. 

It was a Friday night downtown and the Container Park was very busy so we were prepared to wait a bit for our food but to our surprise, even with our order including the sliders, the food came out quickly.

Overall if you are going downtown I highly recommend you stop by Cheffini's and give it a try.
This is my favorite place! Not only do they have the BEST hot dogs, but they play great music and the employees are very personable! You hav to check it out if you are in Vegas!

A sweet young lady quickly brought our order to our shaded table.  I took six ketchup packets that were gooey and stuck together back inside and asked for new ones.  Another girl at the counter didn't lift a finger or so much as offer to help.  She pointed at the cup of packets, then curtly informed me that the trash was 'over there'.  Thanks for the friendly customer service - not.
My mouth felt like a cotton ball after eating here, someone needs to lay off the salt.....

I have been a great fan of Cheffini's for years now, but I was extremely disappointed today when I asked for a vegetarian Godfather and got the super meaty version instead. Mistakes happen, so that's not the problem. The problem was that when I highlighted the issue to the cashier, she was not sympathetic and, instead, blamed the issue on me. No refund, no real apology. Nothing. I have been a vegetarian for five years now, and this is not how I expected my first bite of meat to happen.

The outside of this place gives hope for awesome dogs. Unfortunately, the dogs were not that good. Kind of cold and the bread was unsatisfactorily dry. The cashier definitely was not in a good mood when he took my order. $1 for tap water, very unusual and seems desperate. Maybe I will try this place again when the grumpy dude isn't working.

I cannot say enough about how much I love Cheffinis. The service is great, the beer prices are better, and the dogs are delightful. 

I'm in town for the Life is Beautiful festival and Cheffinis is within the festival grounds. Any beer/cider for $4 (Stella, seasonal beers, Crispin... ALL beers were $4). Needless to say that was the very best deal anywhere within (or outside of) festival grounds. To top that, the Cheffini special gives you a Cheffini dog (usually $6-$7) and a beer for $8! Wow!! 

Deals that great naturally drew a crowd, but the staff was FAST and efficient in such a small space (a storage container). Words can't say how much I appreciate their dedication to speed and quality!!!! 

I haven't been to many places in Vegas that make me  feel like/wish I was a local, but this is definitely one of them!!!!!!

Great food, great service! If you are looking for a unique quick treat while shopping, these dogs are for you! I tried the Crispy Dog... Who thought seaweed and crushed potato chips would be great on a dog?! Next time I bring the fam, I'm trying the Grandfather. Keep up the great work!

Nice little place located on freemont street.
Staff is friendly and explained the varsity of food they had as well as the specials they has going on at the moment.
I decided to go for the original Cheffins and moshi moshi dog, both of which were delicious and very filling. I wouldn't hesitate to come back and maybe show some people this place.

Overrated. Bad experience. Waited about 40 minutes for 2 hot dogs. Was told turkey dog takes longer to cook. That much longer?? My husband just had regular dog with nothing but ketchup and mustard. The dogs were nothing special. The sweet potato fries were very good though. We won't be back.

My friends and I were at Container Park pretty late one Sunday evening (it was practically deserted) but wanted some food. Most everything was closed, but we found Cheffini's right near the entrance of the park area. I ordered the Crunchy dog, with onions, red peppers, bacon bits, crushed potato chips, seaweed, sriracha mayo, mustard and fry sauce. Seriously though, I could have ordered anything off the menu and probably would have been very happy. There was a bit of a wait because they had just dropped a new batch of dogs, but I didn't mind. The hot dog came out and it was glorious. Somehow all the crazy toppings complemented each other perfectly and it all tasted amazing. It was a bit too salty for my taste, but my boyfriend and I ate the whole thing and I probably could have shared another. They also have fries, empanadas, sliders and a burger option. You can get a beef dog, turkey dog, or a vegan dog too.

If you like gourmet hot dogs, do not miss this place if you're in the area.

Located in container park, it's the first unit on the left as soon as you enter. The front entrance by the grasshopper. 

There is a list of hot dog combinations that you can choose from or make-your-own.  I chose to make my own and substituted with the veggie dog. I had options of two toppings and sauces. I chose avocado, chimichurri, red onions and chipotle mayo. It only took about 3 min to get it and at around $5 it was awesome!! The bun was soft and held all my toppings. They weren't skimpy on the toppings or sauce. I was so happy I ate every bit of it! 

If I wasn't full I would have or fed a few more! This is a can't miss for vegetarians! Grab a veggie dog and beer and sit out on their patio. Cheers!

This restaurant is so irresponsible!!! I ordered a vegan dog because I DON'T eat meat and they gave me a beef dog. I got so sick that I throw up!!! The staff didn't even care they messed up. I am going to call the owner and inform him/her to train their staff better.

Not impressed at all . I don't know how there hot dogs taste but there hamburger was horrible . The bottom part of the bun was soggy , and the fries where old . You know when you put your left over fries in the refrigerator then microwave them that's exactly what they taste like . They were extremely hard to tasted like it was made yesterday morning . I'm a big ranch fanatic and I wasn't impressed with there ranch either . ):

Pros:
  Awesome hot dogs
  Draft beers
  Friendly service
  Hip decor
  Nice location
Cons:
 None

This is a small restaurant in Container Park, Downtown, Las Vegas. They serve a variety of hot dogs, sliders, and draft beer.

Atmosphere: Warm, but a little too cozy
The lighting in this place adds a well needed warmth on a winter's day. Upon entering the establishment to your left is the cash register and to your left would be the immediate seating. The seats were comfortable enough to sit on. The seating is very tight, and if the entire indoor dining area was full, it would be very difficult to navigate. Good thing there is a dining area outside! 

Food: Not bad at all!
I've had a taste of the chili cheese dog, French fries with dipping sauce, and their sliders. All of these tasted wonderful, each with great flavor and served nice and hot. The only other thing I would like to say would be that the food here is pretty expensive. $8 for 3 tiny sliders? Although they tasted OK, it's not really a good value at all. Their menu does serve some pretty interesting sounding items, but the price of the food is the deal breaker in this case.

Service: It was... AIGHT.
The cashier was polite, but nothing stood out about the service that makes me want to say, "IT was spectacular!" so I will just say the service was mediocre. 

Overall: Not horrible, but nothing spectacular.
The food here tastes great, but it's overpriced. The service and atmosphere are ok, but are nothing special. I would only come back if I had the money to afford such expensive food. Cheffini's is not bad at all, but if you are looking for a bang for your buck, look somewhere else.

Loved the fact how cute and small this place is. We arrived around close to closing time and boy was it delicious! Vegan dog with green sauce, jalepeños, spicy mayo, and avocados filled me.up buttercup! Loved the fact that they served beer too.

First of all, vegetarians are usually out of luck when it comes to finding decent hot dogs. Well, the vegan hot dog at Cheffini's is the best I've ever had. Surprisingly containing no soy, it was so good it had me questioning if they gave me a meat one by mistake. The variety of types of dogs they offer will satisfy anyone and the choice of toppings and fixings will make for some tough choices. I opted for their summer special. A "naked" dog and a drink (soda or beer) for $5 ( plus $1 for a vegan dog). You get a choice of a sauce and a fixing on a naked dog. And, they have 4 beers on draft to choose from. If you decide to get fries, be careful. The small order is enough to feed 2 people. The sweet potato fries were especially good. Coupled with the unique location of being inside a container park, this place is a real treat.

Mi parcero !!! This is the best hot dog place in Las Vegas PERIOD. Run now and yourself a fantastic hotdog make sure you are hungry so you can try at least 3 of them the selection is incredible. And don't forget to also visit the cart. Gracias hermano

If I could give this place zero stars I would. We just got our delivery and they literally messed up the entire order. We don't eat pork and asked for no pork on of the any of the franks which they added anyways. No pineapple sauce on the 2nd vegan dog which they added as well and we also paid for 3 sauces on the side with the fries which we never received as well. Called them and a guy named Oscar didn't seem to even care while being on the phone and told us to "come in with the food" and they'll take care of it. ordered delivery food for a reason! I'm with a sprained ankle and can't drive anywhere. Never ordering from this place again.

I am not usually a hot dog person, but I was craving one when we decided to visit Container Park!

Bonus: It's also a cheap option here! It's gourmet hot dogs, they even offer vegan dogs for an extra $1. You can add pretty much any topping you can imagine to these dogs! The lady at the counter was really friendly too, helping us out with a cheaper deal for the type of hot dog we wanted and giving us all free waters.

The hot dogs themselves were delicious too! I will definitely eat here again

So let me get this straight, you yuppies would rather pay $7 for ONE vegan hot dog instead of buying a pack of 8 for the same price & making them at home??? OK THEN! LOL I don't know about you guys but I don't like getting ripped off & paying MORE for choosing a cruelty-free & healthier option. Why charge vegans MORE?!?! Plus, they use "field roast" which are the worst vegan dogs I've ever had. Come on people! You can do BETTER! ?

This place is one of those treasures that started out as a sidewalk food stall but was so beloved it grew to have its own physical home. It is in the container park downtown, which is already a great spot to check out while in Vegas as it is downtown, has unique and artist shops, a massive playground with a tall slide, and other restaurants. 

The hot dogs are great with a variety of untraditional toppings and sauces that turn a hot dog into a gourmet and reasonably priced treat. I always make sure to get the potatoes chip topping and fry sauce for my fries. 

The sitting area is very limited, with most spots accommodating only two people. There is a vast outdoor seating area they share but most the tables don't have any cover from the sun. So, if the weather is really hot, cold, or raining it may not be the optimal choice. 

This is a order at the front, get a number, and have a seat restaurant. And you can be in and out quickly. Parking may be difficult to find, so you will likely be walking and paying, which is usually fine because the downtown area is interesting to be in.

The food stall is still up down the street, and if you have the option, go there because it is slightly better than he storefront. Both are good options though.

Enjoyed my overall experience here. Tried the Grandfather, the chili cheese and a kid's dog. Realized later that you can upgrade to an all beef dog, which I will definitely do next time, since these were a little rough for my fam. We all felt a little weird after, mostly I think because recently we've eliminated most processed food and haven't had regular hot dogs in a long while. 

For me, the Grandfather would have been perfect with something more pickled & less onions to cut through the richness of the pork belly and egg. The fella said the chili cheese was alright, but I think he would have enjoyed more as an all beef, since he was the first to point that out (hard to please a Vienna fan). All in all, I'd definitely go for the basic fries again, a beer and give an all beef or vegan basic a chance next time.
I LOVE THEIR FOOD , but if you guys say you're open until 11 you need to stay open until 11 and not close at 10:30pm because you wanna clean up and go home early .

This is a great place if you're in need of a cheap, quick meal at Container Park. They offer gourmet hot dogs with interesting toppings such as potato chips, nori (seaweed) and pineapple sauce. I tried the El Mexicano and while it was a tad on the sweet side for my preference, I enjoyed it. The dog is topped with avocado, tomatoes, green sauce, chipotle guava, garlic aoli and cherry pepper relish with a bacon-wrapped dog. You have the option to choose turkey, beef or vegan franks. Service was...interesting. One recommendation I'd make is to add more beer/wine options. Also, prices are just a bit steep for just hot dogs.

Kiddos rated the cheese fries with bacon a 10 out of 10. So good they would even use their own money to buy them!!! Ha! $18 for 2 better be good damn friends. Located just behind the giant praying mantis. Can't miss it.

Unfortunately customer service wasn't the greatest. We weren't greeted, one worker was on his phone while the other was counting their tips & neither of them assisted us until they were finished with what they were doing. A "Hi, welcome. We'll be right with you" would've worked just great. 

3 stars because they do have one of a kind hot dogs & prices are very good. My boyfriend & I watched his hot dog sit on the back counter, ready to be served to him for 10 minutes before it was delivered. It's the little things that really make or break the first time experience.

I've been here a few times now and the hot dogs are always pretty good. The service however is usually pretty awful. I never minded before because the dogs were so yummy and totally worth the lack of service. Yesterday we went there and they were pretty busy so we expected to wait longer than usual. For one nearly plain dog and one Cheffini dog we waited over 40 min. We sat at the table right by the door and noticed several people get their food who ordered after us. I went in to ask what was going on and our plain dog was sitting in a Togo container wide open on the counter where other costumers are ordering and exchanging cash but cheffini dog not in sight.  They quickly made my dog and told me they couldn't find where we were sitting. I asked if the plain dog was still at least warm he promised me it was, it wasn't at all. They made my dog wrong and in about 45 seconds had me a knew one and it was delicious.  I'm still not sure what went wrong with out order and others orders were messed up as well. Maybe it was an off day, short staff, busier than expected, who knows. A simple apology or a smile could have helped this but they were still rude and blamed the issue on us. Always rude service.

Average at best hot dogs. Toppings taste like they've been in the fridge for a week. They did not even melt the cheese. Definitely not fresh. Also in 110 degree weather when we wanted water refills they refused to give us new water cups (our table was 30ft outside and we left the old ones there). Pathetic customer service especially when it's $8 for a hotdog with no sides or drink.
Nothing to write home about. Just a wannabe fancy dogs. Any hot dog stand in Chicago would beat this place hands down. No atmosphere either. Keep walking until you find something better.

I'm not a huge Hot Dog person. However every once in awhile I crave a good hot dog. I tried the El Mexicano and some cheese fries.  The El Mexicano I really was hoping to capture more of a Mexican Hot Dog Style. It had more of sweetness to it rather than spice. Yet still very delicious and will be back

Some comments from my friends as we ate: 
"The best wiener I've ever tasted"
"Best toppings on a... hot dog..."

Seriously, this hot dog was amazing. I had the El Mexicano, with cherry pepper relish, the most perfect sauces ever to be put on a hot dog, avocado (!!!) and other goodies. If you're in The Container Park area, this is the best place to grab a snack and a cold beer. We'll be back for sure. Just be sure to finish your beer before you leave the park... they won't let you take it out!

This gourmet hotdog is located inside Container Park. They focus on creating the best hot dog experience you can have, Cheffinis specializes in serving combinations such as pineapple sauce, crushed potato chips, Jalapeños, deep fried bacon wrapped frank with fresh avocado and chipotle guava, and more. 

The hot dog menu consists of beef, turkey and vegan. Price ranges from $4.99- 8.99. They have kids menu and sides and also beer and drinks. We had the Grandfather hot dog which includes Grilled frank, pork belly, red bell peppers, caramelized onions, crushed potato chips, spicy mayo, basil aioli, pickle mango, topped with a fried quail egg. That was one of the best hotdog I have had. And also Moshi-Moshi that has grilled frank, caramelized onions, seaweed, jalapeño, wine sauce, with spicy mayo. My friend from out of town ordered several for her family and they said they were all delicious.

You order at the counter and the server bring it to your table. Small clean fast food restaurant. I will definetely come back for more.

I really wish I could rate this place higher. It's in a great location, and our party of 8 all left enjoying the food immensely. We ordered everything from the sliders, to salchipapas, to a bunch of the hot dogs, which were all extremely tasty. 

However, we were visiting after a long trip in Vegas, and we were trying to talk to each other about how the trip went, but we couldn't because the workers were talking to each other SO LOUD. They were cursing and talking about whatever home life stuff they had going on.... trips to San Diego, what cameras they own, etc..

Also, many of them were rude when they didn't need to be. One of our party asked about Vegan options, and they made a joke about how there aren't any vegan hot dogs and that we should go somewhere else. This was before our party (minus one) decided to order our $90's worth of food. 

Later, one of us asked for a napkin, and she was rudely directed to take one that was already brought out and placed on a different table than the one she was sitting at. 

Also, one of our group was leaning on the lower table, next to the window facing outside. He was yelled at from way in the back of the store to stop sitting on the table. Then, a woman worker, spoke loudly saying, "where do you come from thinking you can sit on an F******g table?"

Overall great food and location, but horrible service.

Cheffini's is a new favorite of mine in Container Park! After having such great experiences with the hotdog cart, I'm glad I was finally able to stop in at the restaurant that shares its name. And they certainly set the standard for fancy hotdogs in Vegas. --- Yep! I said it: FANCY hotdogs. You couldn't normally find those two words in the same sentence. ;)

The boyfriend and I decided to split two hotdogs - the classic Cheffini's dog and the Panchero - along with a side of cheese fries. My god, they were... INCREDIBLE. My mouth is watering just typing about them right now! Though it is a bit pricy for hotdogs, they're worth every penny... Each of the specialty dogs are jam-packed with seemingly crazy ingredients that work in harmony. Get a little adventurous with your tastebuds! Sure, it can get a bit messy, but each hotdog is truly a work of art. I especially like that they add potato chips to the Cheffini's dog. It gave it a certain salty crunch that I didn't even know I wanted!

Hands down the worst customer service experience I've ever had. The employee was so rude, for no reason mind you, that I canceled my order and asked to see the general manager. That's when, with an indignant attitude, she informed me she was the GM.
I couldn't believe my ears!
Why would anyone with such distain for people work in customer service?! If she treats customers this poorly I can only imagine how she treats her staff.
If you enjoy someone who's curt, rolls her eyes at every question and acts like your wasting her time then this is the place for you.

I love gourmet hotdogs and this place delivered!

Just inside the entrance of Container Park (which is a great place to hang out - kids or not), this cute little hotdog joint delivers unique hotdogs and even allows you to make your own if you'd like.

Inside seating kinda feels like a subway car, but you can relax in air-conditioning while people watching if you stay inside. Outdoor seating is plentiful (it is a park, after all) and relaxing.

No, they don't have a Chicago dog. However, it's something I'm told they are evaluating whether or not to place on their menu.

However, there are quite a few choices in dogs and believe me, you won't go away hungry!

PS - the fries are great and plentiful as well!

Truly the best hotdog I've ever eaten in my life. A religious experience to say the least. I can't eat other hotdogs without thinking about the hotdog I ate at Cheffinis. I literally talk about this hotdog at length at least once a week. I would highly recommend this place to anyone. The highlight of my trip to Las Vegas, for sure. God bless the good work you do at this establishment.

**Overall, The best hotdog restaurant in the entire world.

This is the first container on your left when you enter container park. The idea of gourmet hot dogs seemed pretty weird. My wife and I both tried the Cheffini dog without onions. You really wouldn't think that they would taste good but they are very good. The sweetness hits you at the beginning. Then you get a kick of heat at the end with the jalapeño. Definitely worth trying.

This place is legit. Try the Grand Father dog, with a fried quail egg. They serve beer and have a variety of specialty dogs, or you can choose your own toppings. Plus, the location in Container Park is great.

So what I love about this place is the fact that they have vegan dogs. BUT the hot dogs themselves are not the greatest to be honest. The hot dogs sound exciting and fun when you read the description, but when I got my hot dog and tried it, I wasn't very impressed. What I was impressed with was the cheese fries. Yum they're so good and packed with cheese. Service is okay. The cashiers are not so welcoming which is disappointing since I left them tips. But whatever. All I recommend is the cheese fries.

Great choices of gourmet hot dogs,great customer service. Staff is very nice and friendly.
My favorite hot dog is the Mexicano, it a bacon wrapped with fresh avocado on top.
There is also have delicious Colombian empanadas that you can enjoy the food while you drink a cold, refreshing draft beer.
Definitely recommend this place!

I found this on Yelp and was really interested to find a great hot dog place.

We got a Cheffinis and El Mexicano and some sweet potato fries.  They were all quite delicious with some great unique flavors.

The sweet potato fries are some of the boat that I have ever had.  The sauce that comes was had a little barbecue flavor and was awesome.

Great setting at the container park with great places to sit outside or inside.  Definitely recommend.

Here are the Cliff Notes...

What's good about Cheffini's?
-Located in Container Park.  
-It's quick
-Their hot dogs are pretty good. I prefer the Beef Naked Dog with absolutely nothing on it.  It's suppose too be naked, right?
-Their sliders.  IMO, the best item at Cheffini's
-The Beef Empanadas
-The employees are awesome

What's bad about Cheffini's?
-The price: $5 for a "plain as can be" hot dog.  I expect to pay upwards of $5 for a plain hot dog at a movie theater or a football game, but not at Container Park.  They're dogs with all the fun stuff will set you back around $10.  
-The beef empanadas are good, but they're tiny.  They're more like empanada bites.

3 Stars because Cheffini's Hot Dogs is A-Ok.

You're drinking downtown and you need some quick food to kick start your recovery...Cheffini's has ya covered..(so I've heard=)...

Cheffini's Service: Cashier's are quick with getting your order to the kitchen.  You're immediately given a number for your table as this keeps the ordering area free.  The kitchen got my hot dog to the table quickly.

Cheffini's Dogs, dog: The Grandfather is my #1 at Cheffini's.  The pork belly, spicy mayo and the fried quail egg really bring this home for me.  The naked dog and fries have always been good to me as well.  They don't skimp on the size of the hot dogs which I appreciate.

Because they're located in container park, you're going to have a small dining area inside.  There's plenty of seating outside to get a view of the park which is a better dining area in my opinion if the weather is nice.  

Unfortunately for my diet, I seem to pick up a naked dog as a 'snack' even when I'm not hungry and in the area. This is a great place to take of your hot dog craving when it kicks in.  See you at the next Container Park visit! =)

The hot dogs here are extremely good! And I love that they have several options on their menu besides hot dogs. I've tried the panchero dog (onions, chimicurri and anji sauce), the salchi papa fries (fries, cheffini fry sauce, sliced hot dogs), different fry sauces (chipotle guava, pineapple sauce, cheffini fry sauce), and their sweet potato fries. So far, I've loved everything that I've tried. 

I get my nails done on the third floor of container park every two weeks for the past three years. Every now and then I get hungry and decide to walk around to try different spots around the area. This one never let me down. They also sell beer, soft drinks, various fry dishes, burgers, chicken tenders, hot dogs, and more. The price is reasonable for what it is.   The average price per hotdog is anywhere from $5-$9, and is definitely worth it. 

They have some indoor seating that is comfortable and hip(but small since it is in a shipping container) and I love that there's outdoor seating right outside the door so you can get a nice view of container park. Everyone who works there has always been friendly. From the cashier, to the cooks, etc. Also, they have a coffee shop attached to it that has the same staff. That... you must check out as well. 

If you love hot dogs, fries, or various dipping sauces- you've gotta try this place. Cheffini's gets five stars for me

This is a solid 4 star restaurant situated in container park. They have everything from a traditional hotdog to an Asian infused dog with all the fixings. Awesome place to stop and have a quick lunch in a laid back environment.

From hot dog cart to having a restaurant front in Container Park, I feel like Cheffini's is a true Cinderella story!  I've frequented their hot dog cart plenty of times on the weekends when bar hopping downtown and was completed satisfied with their hot dogs then so I was curious to see how their actual restaurant compared.  Came here on a Friday night around 7:30 pm and there were no other customers inside, the weather was really nice out though so most of the customers were dining outside.  The place itself is really small as most of the businesses are inside the Container Park.  We went inside and were greeted instantly, paid for our food and given a number.  We grabbed a table outside and the worker brought out our food about 10 minutes later.  

We ordered:
-Classic Cheffini's Hot Dog ($5.99) - comes topped with the normal toppings onions, mustard, ketchup BUT they also throw on jalapenos, mozzarella cheese, potato chips, and pineapple sauce, not sure what the hell the person was thinking when this concoction was created but boy is it TASTY!
-Crunchy Dog Hot Dog ($6.99) - topped with onion, peppers, bacon, potato chips, seaweed, sriracha, and fry sauce didn't get to try this because my friend devoured his but he said it was good! 
-Side of Large Fries ($4) - Nice and crispy the fries were extra long too and they give you a lot with a side of fry sauce

For some reason I think compared to the hot dog stand, here gives you more food.  At the stand I would usually need two hot dogs to fill me up (maybe it was because I was slightly intoxicated when eating at the cart), but here I was full with one hot dog and a shared plate of fries.  No complaints with this place at all, I will be back!

I've only experienced the original cheffinis once at about 1 am with a good buzz going. So you can imagine it was the most delicious hot dog ever. It might have been the alcohol, it might not have been I can't say for sure.  BUT I do crave it so maybe there was something there. 

When Ty told me there was one going up in the container park I told him it was a must!  Plus little man loves the playground there so he never days no. We went on a Saturday which is normally busy but we think the gloomy weather may have had something to do with it because the amount of people were manageable. 

As you walk by the giant praying mantis into the park, cheffinis is located past the coffee shop on the left side where the old pork and beans was. If you've ever been in it before you know how absurdly small it is. They replaced the long middle table for three tall tables on one side and a short table that stretches the length of the window.  The menu is available above the order counter. The selections varied slightly and came with preselected toppings. There was an option to get a naked dog and add two toppings of your choice plus sauces for the price of $4.99. For me that's normally what I would go for, but the El Mexicano stood out to me. That will run you $6.99 not including drink or side. 

El Mexicano - this was a bacon wrapped all beef dog (you have the option of beef, turkey or vegan)  with a cherry pepper relish, green sauce, garlic aioli,  Chipotle guava, onions, tomatoes, avocado and a cilantro garnish. 

Lots of flavor and lots of spice! The hot dog was super juicy and had that snappy crunch when you bit into it. And all the toppings kept my taste buds going!  Delicious!!  We didn't try any sides and thankfully because the one hot dog was plenty. I was stuffed to the rafters. I was a bit disappointed in the iced tea we had. It tasted sour like tea does when it's old :/.  But overall a great experience and I will come back when we are in the container park.

I ordered the El Mexicano and the Cheffini's dogs and both were great. The Mexicano had a green cilantro sauce on top that was perfectly tangy with a lot of flavor. And the crunch of the bacon wrapped around the hot dog was a great texture change. The Cheffini's dog had a sweet and savory combo that worked great together and that little bits of chips was a delicious surprise.
We randomly came across the Container Park around lunchtime so stopped in Cheffini's for a a quick hot dog lunch. What a great surprise to discover how delicious these hot dogs are!

I'm pretty glad that Cheffini's managed to evolve from a cart to a standalone restaurant. The glorious hot dog is one of the most perfect foods to follow a drunken pub crawl around downtown. It gives me a reason to set food once again in Container Park - a place that didn't interest me much before.

Keep in mind that you're getting gourmet hot dogs in here. A plain dog will cost you $4.99, with the fancier stuff going more toward $6-9. ~$8 is a little much to pay for one hot dog, but hey, I could tell they used some quality ingredients into my dog, so I'll let it slide. If you are more of the "quantity over quality" type, you may have to sit at a nearby casino cafe and order a gigantor hot dog that they usually serve for a couple bucks.

Price point aside, the hot dog I got was very good. I got the Crunchy Dog - a hot dog concoction with all sorts of crunchies all over it (bacon, potato chips, fried onions, etc.). It's also topped with nori (seaweed) and sriracha mayo to give a bit of an Asian twist. I wasn't necessarily blown away by it, but it was still good.

Would I come back? Probably. The price point is something that I'm starting to see from all renovations going around east downtown. There are times that I crave a hot dog and go out of my way for it. Cheffini's does one good and it's definitely some of the best in the area.

Super delicious hot dog! I had the El Mexicano, such surprisingly delicious! Willie had the Crunchy dog he was impressed the seaweed was a good addition this did did not have the potato chips. But it was still good. 
The cheese fries yummy probably my favorite of all time!! Willie thought they were just alright as much effort went into the dogs he expected more pizazz. You must try!

Panchero dog with chorizo bites, carmelized onions, red bell pepper aioli and chimichurri was a nice departure from the traditional hot dog. Grilled frank was flavorful and all the toppings came together for a unique flavor combinations! Would definitely try some of their other choices next time!

Cheffini's serves some mighty tasty hot dogs. I appreciate the warm bun, crisp outside and soft inside. Dogs have great flavor and the variety of toppings were all well thought out and properly executed. The fries are thin and crisp with the perfect amount of salt (and the fry sauce was a great accompaniment).  Bravo Cheffini's!  I would rate this place right up there with Buldogis in the "gourmet" hot dog market in Vegas.

Good dogs, fry's so so. Prices are kind of high

So was at Work In Progress and strolled down to the container park for lunch. Being Sunday it was very busy but this place seemed less crowded. Ah, but they deliver to the tables around the park. 

The menu was interesting. While hot dog based the add on's were very eclectic. So it will take some time to decide your first time. Even saw a vegan dog on their menu, huh? I ordered the Panchero dog and expected a kick to it which it did not have. 

All in all,  not a bad choice. Next time I will study the menu more.
Havent had a hotdog that good in Awhile A++ and the service was so polite and accommodating

I'll start off with how friendly the cashier was and how nice it was on the inside. Really filling hotdog with great taste to boot. 
And the prices aren't expensive at all here. Waiting for the hot dogs didn't take long at all either. Great for lunch and for the family.

Had the Cheffini's special hot dog with a cup of beer. Their namesake dog is topped with almost everything, potato chips and a sweetnsavory yellow sauce. 

Pal said he liked the firm bun comforting his dog. Dad just scarfed a simple sauerkraut dog with no complaints.

Inside and outside seating. Cute little joint located at the entrance of the container park.

I've been here twice now and can say that they are making some mighty delicious hot dogs. 

My first visit was part through a food tour and we had the Classic Cheffinis. It sounded a little crazy with several sauces, potato chips, and mozzarella cheese, but it was a great flavor combination. I like that the hot dog bun holds up to all of the toppings until the last bite as well.

On second visit I had the El Mexicano and Grandfather. The Grandfather was my favorite with pork belly, onion, aioli, mayo, pickled mango, and a quail egg on top. The El Mexicano also featured some unique sauces including cherry pepper relish and fresh avocado slices. Both dogs had buns that held all of the yummy toppings and sauces. Our table also shared French fries and everyone agreed that they were delicious fries. 

In addition to hotdogs and fries they also offer alcohol on tap, bottled beers, milkshakes, and empanadas (!). So much goodness in this tiny spot. I like to enjoy my food at the tables outside of the restaurant on a nice day.
I enjoyed my Chili Cheese dog. The meat in the chili was just spicy enough for my taste. The staff was great and pleasant even on a busy day. The food is a little pricey for a hot dog but worth it!

You don't know how dogs until you've had their hot dogs pull up the Container Park grab a seat or a crunchy dog or Mushy Mushy get those sweet potato fries. Get ready to have the most delicious hot dogs and your entire life

These hot dogs are amazing ! Four stars because despite the fact they are fully loaded  kinda expensive I bout two hot dogs and total came out to about 16$. Something about the bread. Not stale but not fresh either. Other than that it was amazing!

I came here because the street vendor hot dog wasn't out. I went for a bacon wrapped hot dog. 

I get here and notice they serve cheese fries. I also notice the excess amount of toppings for "el Mexicano" bacon wrapped hot dog. I decide to order the two. I was somewhat curious what their combination would taste like so I didn't make any changes. 

The initial bite was interesting.. very sweet. And saucy. My MAIN complaint about the hot dog was that it was FRIED!.... you don't fry a bacon wrapped hot dog. It's lazy and would probably cause a heart attack. Bacon wrapped hot dogs should be grilled to keep the texture. 

The cheese fries were horrible.. I'm sorry. I never complain about things but this was overpriced garbage. The cheese fries had its own style of saucy cheese. I could taste the corn startch/flour in it. It was gritty and flavorless. The texture was so off. The fries were too thick. 

It was $8.00 for a normal sized hot dog and $8.00 for cheese fries. Nearly $30 after tax. For two dogs and cheese fries. I would have been happier going to a real restaurant for that amount. 

Trash.

Delicious! We got 2 veggie El Mexicanos and a Panchero plus amazing crispy thick sweet potato fries that come with a creamy ketchupy delicious mildly spiced sauce. 

Service was pretty good but would be the only slight sadface. One must whistle to get their attention - just need a bell on the door (they were working hard in the kitchen washing dishes and couldn't hear us come in (to order, ask for a refill, get a 2nd dog) we were also there at 10pm so it was late but the park is open until 1am. all in all really great and the container park is super fun with shops and the fire-blowing praying mantis!

Eh. Im NOT a hot dog person. I went to this place at the urging of my coworker. I tried the grandfather and it was not anything special not pleasant. Don't waste your money here. Go next door and get tacos like I did.
Hot dogs are so freaking delicious but not five stars cause the little cart by the casino sells them for 4 dollars instead smh

Had the panchero and the moshi moshi. The moshi moshi had old caramelized onions. Like almost about to rot. The panchero tasted like nothing like its ingredients. Faux-taste. These hot dogs have nothing special. Sweet potatoes fries were great. Service was great.
This so was good!!! It was amazing after the wine festival! I love hots dogs. And I also have variety such as turkey, vegan, and beef!

Stopped in after exploring downtown. Hate to give 3 stars but it was just too much. I wanted to like it but there were just to many ingredients to really appreciate it. Got the original cheffini's. Liked some elements- the potato chips!- but too many flavors for me.
Yummy and tasty hot dog.  The frank was grilled nicely with 2 toppings and sauces.  I really enjoyed.

My cheffinis hot dog, what just the right amount of spicy with a hint of sweet. What a way to dress up a simple hot dog, into perfection. Although, my experience would have been more like able. If I didn't have to listen to a woman (African American) on the phone complaining about her staff and her boss. Not really good business educate. And I certainly wouldn't want someone like hat representing my business.

My boyfriend and I came on a Monday afternoon (the day after the Life is Beautiful Festival). This is such a cute little shop located inside Container Park with only a few seats indoors. We ordered the following:

Moshi Moshi: $6.99
Grilled frank, carmelized onions, sea weed, jalapeño, wine sauce, spicy mayo, topped with sesame seeds

Cheffinis: $5.99
Grilled frank, onions, tomatoes, jalapeños, mozzarella cheese, potato chips, pineapple sauce, mustard, mayo and ketchup

Cheese fries: $7.99
French fries smothered in homemade cheddar cheese

Everything was delicious!

Not a really bad place, I just downvote anywhere that charges for water, especially in Vegas. $1 for tapwater. It's just the kind of practice that tends to get people hurt here. Water should be free.

Other than that, hotdogs are good.

Hipster little joint here. The menu is pretty straight forward and they have some unique selections for hot dogs. We had hot dogs, the cheeseburger, and chicken fingers (for the kids). I personally had El Mexicano and it was super tasty, but $7 for a single hot dog is a little bit ridiculous. The kids didn't like the chicken fingers and the burger was just bad. Customer service was not great either. The cashier had a little of an attitude problem taking our "complex" order.
This was my second visit to the container park and to Cheffinis. Both visits were wonderful and the hotdogs were amazing both times!!! Tried the grand father and Moshi Moshi. Loved them both.

What a cute, little hot dog spot. My mom and I were so hungry one day wondering through Container Park, and stumbled upon this place. The guy behind the counter was extremely helpful and kind when taking our order. 

On the menu, they have a variety of hot dogs, including veggie, woot! And different toppings you can pile on if you choose. Even offer a kids menu, and other food than hot dogs. 

I ordered a veggie dog, and I have to say it was very delicious. Sometimes when you order a veggie dog, it looks skimp. But not these veggie dogs! There really wasn't a difference in size between mine and my moms beef hot dog. Which she said hers was delicious, too. It's almost like you don't want your hot dog to end, it's so good. And of course we ordered fries on the side, which were fried to perfection. I always like mine a little crispy, but still soft. These were just right! 

I've always heard people talking about "The man with the hot dog cart" posted down on Fremont, and little did I know, it was this place with their delicious dogs. They don't have vegan dogs at the cart, though. Only in store. All the reason to come back! Which I do.

Really, Cheffini's needs to stop with their CRUNCHY DOG!

It's so yummy.  Messy & Yummy!
The hotdog I tried was the grandfather. It a amazing and full of flavors. It has a nice atmosphere and the food came out very fast. I can't wait to come back and try out the other hotdogs they offer

My wife and I stopped in for a quick bite while we were in container park. As a self proclaimed connoisseur of hot dogs, I have to say I was quite pleased. I ordered the naked with cheese and my wife had the same. The hot dogs were great and you could definitely tell that they were made of quality beef. The fries were exceptional as well. Nice and hot when they were brought to us. 
We will be definitely paying a return visit the next time we are at container park. 

(Sorry no pics this time around)

These hot dogs were yummy! We tried the Mexican hot dog which is a hot dog wrapped in bacon with avocado and a bunch of other sauces that I can't remember off the top of my head. We split it three ways because we were using it as a snack before our actual dinner. I enjoyed it and was a great treat to split. If you really enjoy bacon this would be the one for you. If you like hot dogs in general they have a wide variety of toppings and hot dogs to choose from.
Panchero dog I think it was called was super good! Small seating area inside but on a beautiful day outside works!

We were in town for a few days and wanted to see what the hype was all about. We shared a Cheffini's dog. It was loaded with onions, tomatoes, jalapeño, mozzarella cheese, crumbled potato chips (stale), and four kinds of sauces: pineapple, mustard, mayo, and ketchup. It was a pretty good portion size but there were just too many flavors fighting over each other. The flavors weren't complimentary at all. I tasted the ketchup and mustard the most. We checked-in to get a free drink, so that was a plus. Besides that, the hotdog was pretty average.

I was pretty excited when I found out Cheffini's opened an actual location. Let's be real, I've had several drunken nights that led me to the hot dog cart and every experience was heavenly! I always wondered if this would be any better...especially while sober. So, the other day I was wandering the Container Park and just couldn't leave without amusing my curiosity. I ordered the Cheffini. It was loaded with toppings and better than I remembered. Plus, they had sweet potato fries! The serving was pretty generous too. Can't wait to go back to try some of the other options.

Such an amazing hotdog joint  I've been wanting to try this place out for a while and glad I finally made it. Was well worth the drive. Ask for one of the favorites because that's what I did and was not disappointed

While visiting Container Park we decided to get a hot dog. The space is super small, but there is plenty of outdoor seating. 
I love that Cheffini's has unique toppings and sauces. On this visit I wasn't that adventurous, but I did order the Kids Cheffini's Dog. It came with potato chips, topped with Ketchup and a side of fry sauce. I was expecting the hot dog to be small since it was a kids one, but it wasn't! It was a huge hot dog. The hot dog had great flavor. It reminded me of a polish hot dog almost. I enjoyed the crunchy chips on top as well. 

Next time I'll be more adventurous with the sauces and toppings. I also want to try their fries. Especially since they had excellent fry sauce. This is a great spot of everyone in your family. You can't go wrong with a great hot dog!!

Tiny little spot but the staff is super friendly and even with a line out the door, the service was really fast. With plenty of seating outside on the patio and a nice view of the unique container park. I tried the el mexicano and it was seriously good!  Loved the crispy bacon wrapped around the dog... added a nice crunch!   Will definitely go back and try more

Awwwww, no chilli dogs til Fri, Sat, Sunday!  I really wanted that chilli dog!  Also the beer I like it's seasonal, so I will have to return in the fall for the brew I like.  But it was a good experience.  I tried the crunchy dog.  It was different.....Since they didn't have the chilli dog, I was forced to try something else.  Don't get me wrong, it was good, but you know when your mouth is watering for what you want, and it's not available......... yea!   Service was good, and quick. No issues with that.  I will be back on a Fri, Sat or Sunday for a chilli dog!

Cheffini's has made a comeback in my opinion.

A few years ago, I was boycotting this place. The customer service was crappy. I still remember this once particular girl who was totally miserable, all of the time. Their prices were ridiculous for what you got. HOWEVER... I found myself here when the taco shop next door dropped the ball and my starving child was, well, starving. And he loves hot dogs and fries.

Erica was, and is, awesome. I let her know that my son couldn't eat the bun because of his food allergies. Both she and Oscar, the cook, made sure that T's food was good to go.
